column2: tenpo pi mute lili la jan Ton li mu pi pilin musi.
jan Ton li kalama musi uta lon tenpo pi mute lili.
mani li ante e ale.
mi mute li tawa kepeken noka.
mi wile moku e telo la mi moku e telo.
column3: I drink water when I'm thirsty.

column2: o len e ona.
tenpo suno open la mi moku e pan e ko kili suwi.
column3: I eat bread with jam for breakfast.

column2: jan pi pona sona li lon ala la, mi li seme?
column3: Who would I be without my teachers?

column2: waso toki tu pi laso kasi li toki tawa mi.
column3: Two green parrots were talking to me.

column2: mi jo e poki lete tu lon tomo seli.
column3: We have two fridges in the kitchen.

column2: ni li monsuta. ni li pona mute tawa mi.
o pali ala e ni: sina toki kepeken toki pona. o lukin o sitelen e toki pona taso.
column3: Toki Pona is not a language to be spoken, but only to be read and written.
